content:
• Monday, November 6, 2017
  • MTDR

    Matador Resources beats by $0.08, beats on revenue

    • Matador Resources (NYSE:MTDR): Q3 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.08.
    • Revenue of $126.28M (+42.3% Y/Y) beats by $3.21M.
    • Shares +2.9% AH.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 PM
  • BGS

    Wacha named new chief financial officer at B&G Foods

    • B&G Foods (BGS -2.1%) is promoting Bruce Wacha to chief financial officer and executive VP of Finance, effective Nov. 27.
    • Wacha is currently executive VP of Corporate Strategy and Business Development, a role he will continue to hold where he oversees M&A, capital markets transactions and investor relations.
    • He had joined the company from Amira Nature Foods, where he had spent three years as that company's CFO and executive director of the board; that followed more than 15 years in the financial services industry.
    • Interim CFO Amy Chiovari will continue in her role as corporate controller.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:28 PM
  • WIN

    Windstream prices upsized offering of 2025 debt

    • Windstream Holdings (WIN +5.6%) has upsized and priced an offering of 2025 notes.
    • The company's offering $400M in 8.625% senior first lien notes at 99%, to yield 8.802%.
    • Net proceeds of that offering will go to repay debt under its revolving credit and a under its Tranche B6 term loan.
    • Earlier, it issued yet another extension of a consent solicitation on 6 3/8% notes to 5 p.m. ET today, expecting to receive a majority.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:39 PM | 25 Comments
  • NCMI

    National CineMedia beats Q3 expectations with steady growth

    • National CineMedia (NCMI +4.2%) beat expectations with Q3 earnings with revenue and underlying profits that grew steadily.
    • Net income attributable to the company rose to $9.4M from $8.2M. Adjusted OIBDA rose 2.8% to $62.6M, beating an expected $57.4M.
    • It was a stable quarter after a challenging first half, said CEO Andy England: "Third quarter 2017 revenue was up 2.6% over last year as the scatter market rebounded in our favor, even as network attendance was down 16.1%."
    • It's reaffirmed full-year guidance for revenues to decline between 1 and 6% (to $422M-$442M, vs. consensus for $428.9M), and OIBDA to fall between 6 and 12% (to $202M-$217M, vs. expected $208.4M); the company says both numbers are trending toward the lower end of their ranges.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 6:32 PM
  • MTW

    Manitowoc +5% on surprise Q3 profit; orders rise 21% Y/Y

    • Manitowoc (NYSE:MTW) +4.9% after-hours after posting a surprise Q3 profit, citing a pickup in demand in the U.S. energy and commercial construction markets.
    • Q3 revenues rose 14% Y/Y, mostly attributable to increased demand, primarily in the U.S. market; the company says ~40% of unit revenue came from new products introduced since becoming a stand-alone crane company.
    • MTW says Q3 orders totaled $376M, up 21% Y/Y, and backlog at the end of the quarter was $468M, up 32% Y/Y from $353M.
    • MTW also reaffirms guidance for FY 2017, seeing revenues down 5%-7% to $1.5B-$1.53B vs. $1.51B analyst consensus estimate, with adjusted EBITDA of $59M-$69M.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: NPTN +13.7%. WTW +10.5%. KND +8.3%. SLCA +4.7%. MTW +4.3%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: TLGT -33.3%. TRUE -28.0%. RRGB -22.3%. QTNA -20.9%. PCMI -18.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • AFSI

    AmTrust selling majority stakes in some operations; shares up 3.7%

    • The buyer is Madison Dearborn Partners, and AmTrust (NASDAQ:AFSI) is selling a 51% interest in certain of its U.S. fee-based businesses. The deal values the business at $1.15B.
    • Through a combination of MDP's equity investment of about $210M and debt borrowings by the new business, AmTrust will receive gross cash proceeds of about $950M at closing.
    • The company sees net tangible book value per share gaining about $6 as a result of the transaction proceeds.
    • Closing is expected in H1 of next year.
    • Source: Press Release
    • AFSI +3.7% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM | 43 Comments
  • SLCA

    U.S. Silica beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • U.S. Silica (NYSE:SLCA): Q3 EPS of $0.50 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $345M (+150.5% Y/Y) beats by $14.25M.
    • Shares +1.5% AH.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM | 9 Comments
  • OUT

    Outfront Media beats on top, bottom lines in Q3

    • Outfront Media (OUT +3.2%) has posted Q3 earnings where gains in the company's transit unit outpaced its core billboard division and powered a beat.
    • OIBDA ticked up to $120.8M vs. an expected $118M.
    • Revenues grew 2.5% but up 1.5% organically.
    • "Although national revenues remain a headwind, we once again kept our controllable expenses flat, driving a slight improvement in Adjusted OIBDA," says CEO Jeremy Male.
    • Revenue by type: Billboard, $272.4M (up 0.7%); Transit and other, $120M (up 6.9%).
    • Earnings slides
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM | 3 Comments
  • KNOP

    KNOT Offshore Partners to launch 3M-unit offering

    • KNOT Offshore Partners (NYSE:KNOP) -4.3% after-hours as it commences a public offering of 3M common units; no mention is made of an underwriters option to purchase additional units.
    • KNOP says it plans to use the proceeds from the offering, and a related capital contribution by its general partner to maintain its general partner interest, for general partnership purposes, which may include acquisitions, capex, repaying debt and funding working capital.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM | 67 Comments
  • THC

    Tenet Q3 revenues down 5%; loss widens; guidance lowered; shares down 9% after hours

    • Tenet Healthcare (NYSE:THC) Q3 results ($M): Revenues: 4,586 (-5.4%).
    • Net Loss: (367) (-999%); Loss/Share: (3.63) (-999%); CF Ops (9 mo.): 709 (-16.7%).
    • 2017 Guidance: Revenue: $18.9B - 19.1B from $19.1B - 19.4B (ex. $110M from Co's health plans); net loss: ($367M - 372M) from ($90M - 115M); non-GAAP EBITDA: $2.375B - 2.425B; non-GAAP EPS: $0.59 - 0.74 from $0.69 - 0.99.
    • Shares are down 9% after hours on modest volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM | 11 Comments
  • NPTN

    NeoPhotonics up 11.6% after Q3 beats, in-line guidance

    • NeoPhotonics (NYSE:NPTN) shares are up 11.58% aftermarket following Q3 EPS and revenue beats with in-line guidance.
    • Q4 guidance has revenue from $69M to $74M (consensus: $71.48M) and EPS from -$0.23 to -$0.13 (consensus: -$0.21).
    • Key metrics: Non-GAAP gross margin, 18.6% (down from 23.9% sequentially); adjusted EBITDA, -$4.5M (compare: $48K prior quarter); cash and equivalents, $73.7M; total operating expenses, $29.4M. 
    • Press release     
    • Previously: NeoPhotonics beats by $0.06, beats on revenue (Nov. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • MTW

    Manitowoc beats by $0.11, beats on revenue

    • Manitowoc (NYSE:MTW): Q3 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.11.
    • Revenue of $399.4M (+14.2% Y/Y) beats by $14.39M.
    • Shares +1.85%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • IDRA

    Idera Pharmaceuticals beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • Idera Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDRA): Q3 EPS of -$0.10 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $0.16M (-50.0% Y/Y) beats by $0.03M.
    • Shares +1.1%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM | 9 Comments
  • MCHP

    Microchip Technology reports Q2 beats, positive guidance

    • Microchip Technology (NASDAQ:MCHP) drops 0.39% aftermarket despite Q2 EPS and revenue beats with in-line and better guidance.
    • Q3 guidance has revenue from $971.7M to $1.01B (consensus: $984.49M) and EPS from $1.30 to $1.40 (consensus: $1.30). 
    • Key metrics: Gross margins, 61%; cash flow from operations, $350.1M; cash and equivalents, $1.844B; inventory, 105 days (up 5 days from June quarter). 
    • Press release   
    • Previously: Microchip Technology Inc. declares $0.3625 dividend (Nov. 6)
    • Previously: Microchip Technology beats by $0.06, beats on revenue (Nov. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • VERI

    Veritone -10.1% as expenses drive wider loss

    • Veritone (VERI +6.3%) has fallen 10.1% after hours following Q3 earnings where revenue didn't grow in keeping with analyst expectations, and operating expenses rose 192% as the company invested in its AI platform.
    • Net loss attributable to common shareholders came to $19.4M, vs. a year-ago loss of $8.2M, though loss per share declined as the company has 14.8M weighted-average shares outstanding vs. a previous 2.4M.
    • Revenues grew 60% to $3.7M, with $1.1M in gains from media agency revenues and $0.3M from SaaS licensing revenues. Those led to higher operating leverage and a higher margin.
    • The company saw Y/Y growth over its key performance indicators, CEO Chad Steelberg says, and "while we remain increasingly optimistic about our organic growth prospects, we are also continuing to selectively explore acquisition opportunities."
    • Cash and equivalents and marketable securities came to $60.4M as of quarter's end.
    • The company's initial offering lockup expires Wednesday.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM | 6 Comments
  • CAR

    Avis Budget in retreat after earnings

    • Investors are punishing Avis Budget (NASDAQ:CAR) after the car rental company trimmed the top end of its full-year revenue guidance range.
    • During Q3, unit fleet costs in the Americas rose 5% to outpace the 1% increase in revenue. Adjusted EBITDA fell 1% to $303M. International revenue increased 9% and international adjusted EBITDA was 8% higher.
    • Avis now expects revenue of $8.80B to $8.90B vs. $8.80B to $8.95B prior and adjusted EBITDA of $725M to $745M vs. $725M to $775M prior.
    • CAR -9.83% AH to $37.50.
    • Previously: Avis Budget beats by $0.10, misses on revenue (Nov. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • ETSY

    Etsy EPS of $0.21

    • Etsy (NASDAQ:ETSY): Q3 EPS of $0.21 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.06.
    • Revenue of $106.38M (+21.5% Y/Y) beats by $1.43M.
    • Shares +7.06%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • DERM

    Dermira to returns rights to psoriasis candidate Cimzia back to UCB; shares down 1% after hours

    • Citing the priority of launching glycopyrronium tosylate (DRM04), Dermira (NASDAQ:DERM) will terminate its development and commercialization deal with UCB (OTCPK:UCBJF)(OTCPK:UCBJY) for CIMZIA (certolizumab pegol) in psoriasis effective February 15, 2018.
    • No termination or penalty payments are required by either party. In consideration of reacquiring global rights, UCB will pay Dermira $11M by November 13 and $39M within 30 days of U.S. approval of CIMZIA in psoriasis (application currently under review). Dermira will pay UCB up to $10M for development costs incurred between January 1 and June 30, 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • SWKS

    Skyworks drops despite Q4 beats, in-line guidance

    • Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS) shares drop 4.58% aftermarket despite reporting Q4 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates. Q1 guidance has $1.05B in revenue and EPS of $1.91 and both match consensus estimates.
    • Key metrics: Gross margin, 51%; operating margin, 38.5%; cash flow from operations, $425.4M; total operating expenses, $153M; cash and equivalents, $1.6B. 
    • Press release     
    • Previously: Skyworks Solutions beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (Nov. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM | 13 Comments
  • CLDT

    Capital raise for Chatham Lodging; shares down 1.5%

    • The company is offering 5M common shares with underwriter greenshoe of 750K shares.
    • Funds ($41M) are expected to be used for the purchase of two Charleston, SC hotels, and ($68M) for the acquisition of an upper upscale all-suites hotel in the D.C. area.
    • Source: Press Release
    • CLDT -1.5% to $22.25.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 18 Comments
  • ZAYO

    Zayo Group -3.4% as Q1 earnings miss

    • Zayo Group (NYSE:ZAYO) has slipped 3.4% after hours following fiscal Q1 earnings that missed expectations despite revenues that grew 27%.
    • Net income grew 48% Y/Y but was flat sequentially at $23.2M -- $11.5M from Communications Infrastructure, $11.7M from Allstream.
    • EBITDA grew 21% to $316.6M, falling short of an expected $319.7M.
    • Bookings grew to $7.6M from a previous $7.2M; gross installs were $7.3M (up from $6.5M) and net installs came to $1.2M (flat). Churn was 1.2%.
    • Unlevered free cash flow came to $130.9M.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • AMC

    Post-earnings slip for AMC Entertainment

    • AMC Entertainment (NYSE:AMC) reports admissions revenue increased 52% to $754M as M&A factored in. Average ticket price during the quarter fell to $9.48 from $9.57 a year ago.
    • Food and beverage revenue rose 45% to $361M. Food and beverage per patron was down 5% to $4.55.
    • AMC's average screen count during Q3 was 10,707 vs. 5,240 a year ago.
    • Looking ahead, AMC expects full-year revenue of $5.00B to $5.20B vs. $5.16B consensus and adjusted EBITDA of $810M to $865M. "In our view, the weakness of the summer box office is not indicative of a long-term trend, especially immediately after two and a half years of record box office performance and just before what we expect will be strong and robust consumer demand through year end," maintains AMC management.
    • Previously: AMC Entertainment beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (Nov. 6)
    • AMC -4.10% AH to $11.70.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 10 Comments
  • NPTN

    NeoPhotonics beats by $0.06, beats on revenue

    • NeoPhotonics (NYSE:NPTN): Q3 EPS of -$0.25 beats by $0.06.
    • Revenue of $71.1M (-31.2% Y/Y) beats by $1.16M.
    • Shares +15.16%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • PRCP

    Perceptron beats by $0.23, beats on revenue

    • Perceptron (NASDAQ:PRCP): Q1 EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.23.
    • Revenue of $19.3M (+10.2% Y/Y) beats by $1.8M.
    • Shares +1.85%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • TRIP

    TripAdvisor down after Q3 revenue miss, Hotel sales drop

    • TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP) shares are down 6.68% aftermarket following Q3 results that beat EPS estimates but missed on revenue.
    • Revenue by segment: Hotel, $312M (-3% Y/Y); Non-Hotel, $127M (+26%).  
    • Hotel revenue breakdown: Branded click-based and transaction, $195M (-5%); Branded display-based ads and subscription, $76M (+4%); Other, $41M (flat).  
    • Key metrics: Avg. monthly unique hotel shoppers, 163M (+7%); avg. monthly unique visitors on branded websites and apps, 455M (+17%); user reviews and opinions, 570M (+32%).  
    • Financials: Adjusted EBITDA, $95M; cash flow from operations, -$135M; FCF, -$150M; total costs and expenses, $397M; cash and equivalents, $750M. 
    • Key quote: “Re-igniting near-term Hotel growth has been more difficult than expected, though continued momentum in Non-Hotels, and most notably, our Attractions business, as well as prudent expense management, have mitigated adjusted EBITDA impacts this year, despite a significant investment in television advertising. We will continue to strike an appropriate balance between near-term growth and profitability as we continue to work towards long-term profitable growth,” says CFO Ernst Teunissen. 
    • Press release     
    • Previously: TripAdvisor beats by $0.01, misses on revenue (Nov. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 25 Comments

    California Resources beats by $0.41, misses on revenue

    • California Resources (NYSEMKT:CRC): Q3 EPS of -$1.22 beats by $0.41.
    • Revenue of $445M (-2.4% Y/Y) misses by $42.85M.
    • Shares +1.2%.

    Weight Watchers beats by $0.11, beats on revenue

    • Revenue of $323.7M (+15.3% Y/Y) beats by $4.3M.
    • Shares +11.58%.

    | 4:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • AKCA

    Akcea Therapeutics misses by $0.08

    • Akcea Therapeutics (NASDAQ:AKCA): Q3 EPS of -$0.27 misses by $0.08.
    • Shares +2.4%.

    | 4:15 PM | 5 Comments
  • BKNG

    Priceline lower after guidance disappoints

    • Priceline (PCLN) trades lower after guidance arrives below expectations.
    • For Q3, the company reported adjusted EBITDA of $2.20B vs. $2.15B consensus.
    • Gross travel bookings increased 18% in Q3 vs. guidance of 11% to 16%. On a constant-currency basis, gross bookings were up 16%.
    • Room nights increased 18.6% during the quarter, while rental car days were up 5.5%. Airline tickets fell 11.8%.
    • The online travel company sees Q4 EPS of $13.40 to $14.00 vs. $15.56 consensus and Q4 EBITDA of $870M to $910M vs. $1.00B consensus.
    • Shares of Priceline are down 6.46% in AH trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 58 Comments
  • GEVO

    Gevo beats by $0.05, beats on revenue

    • Gevo (NASDAQ:GEVO): Q3 EPS of -$0.36 beats by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $7.7M (+11.0% Y/Y) beats by $2.2M.
    • Shares +8.8%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM | 8 Comments
  • EBR

    Reuters: Eletrobras to issue new shares to dilute government stake

    • Brazil's government will not sell the shares it currently owns in state-run power holding company Eletrobras (EBR +6.6%) and instead plans to dilute its controlling stake by issuing new shares, Reuters reports.
    • The government plans to keep a golden share in EBR after it is privatized, according to the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • ATUS

    Altice USA +5.8% after Sprint wireless deal, upgrade

    • Altice USA (NYSE:ATUS) has recouped much of Friday's decline today, +5.8%, in the wake of its deal to enter the wireless market with help from Sprint.
    • The company lost $0.25/share in earnings this quarter.
    • New Street Research has upgraded shares to Buy, though trimming its price target to $33 from $34 -- still implying more than 38% upside from today's already higher price.
    • Earnings slides
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • AAPL

    CreditSights: Apple bond offering could total $7B

    • Research firm CreditSights estimates that Apple’s (NASDAQ:AAPL) new fixed-rate bond offering could total $7B based on a similar deal in September.
    • The September deal had four parts and totaled $5B. 
    • The new offering has up to six parts ranging from 2-year to 30-year bonds and CreditSights estimates pricing at 16 bps to 27 bps of new issue concessions or NICs. 
    • Apple shares are up 1.14%.  
    • Previously: KGI analyst expects two OLED iPhones; Apple offering fixed-rate bonds (Nov. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 13 Comments
  • HMNY

    Helios skyrockets ahead of AMC earnings call

    • Helios and Matheson Analytics (NASDAQ:HMNY) is up 41% on volume 50% higher than normal activity.
    • The MoviePass owner pulled some financial levers earlier today and caught a price target boost from Maxim to $25 in the afternoon. Maxim thinks that Helios sidestepped some of its short-term financial pressure by selling the convertible notes.
    • The call from Maxim arrives just ahead of AMC Entertainment's (AMC +2.5%) earnings call after the close. It's not clear what AMC will say about sharing revenue with MoviePass.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 10 Comments
  • HMNY

    Maxim Group raises its Helios & Matheson price target

    • Maxim Group raises its price target for Helios & Matheson (NASDAQ:HMNY) by $5 to $25.
    • The firm cites this morning’s convertible note offering that Maxim believes can cover MoviePass subscriber overuse. 
    • Maxim believes movie theater chains will become more cooperative with MoviePass as the service becomes more influential.
    • Helios & Matheson shares are up 37.62%. 
    • Previously: MoviePass lands some funding through convertible note offering (Nov. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 6 Comments
  • ALKS

    Sen. Harris launches probe of Alkermes; shares down 4%

    • At issue are the company's attempts to boost sales of its opioid addiction drug Vivitrol.
    • Among the charges is the company's aggressive marketing within the criminal justice system, says Harris, often convincing judges and corrections officials to offer the drug to inmates and parolees, rather than treatments that may have worked better.
    • ALKS -4.25%
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 3 Comments
  • LGF.A

    'Thor' hammers film competition with $123M debut

    • Latest Marvel entry Thor: Ragnarok (DIS +1.6%) blew away competition at the weekend box office, drawing $122.7M domestically to add to $308.3M overseas.
    • The film opened to $55.6M in China, a November record, Box Office Mojo notes. And domestically it bested Spider-Man: Homecoming to deliver the seventh-best Marvel Cinematic Universe opening.
    • Overall, the Marvel Cinematic Universe (17 films strong) has now delivered $5B domestically and $13B globally.
    • It topped STX's A Bad Moms Christmas, with $17M. They were ahead of a couple of post-Halloween fall-offs from Lions Gate (LGF.A +3%, LGF.B +2.7%): In the third spot was Jigsaw, which dropped nearly 60% of its business W/W to land at $6.7M, and fourth was Tyler Perry's Boo 2! A Madea Halloween, which dropped 53.7% to hit $4.65M.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM | 16 Comments
  • GVA

    Granite Construction JV wins $410M project award

    • Granite Construction (GVA +2.8%) hits a 52-week high following news that the joint venture team it leads was awarded a design and build contract for an Interstate 64 widening and bridge project by the Virginia Department of Transportation.
    • The project also includes extensive environmental protections to the adjacent wetland and the Elizabeth River.
    • GVA says it booked its 50% share of the $410M project into backlog during the Q3.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: HMNY +24%. CAVM +11%. AQ +10%. PI +10%. NTES +10%.
    • Losers: XNET -26%. MTBC -24%. EVH -19%. PAR -19%. FNJN -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • MIME

    Dougherty & Company raises Mimecast price target

    • Dougherty & Company raises its Mimecast (NASDAQ:MIME) price target by $4 to $36.
    • Firm cites checks showing Mimecast continuing strong expansion into the North American market with small business and mid-market customers with tailwinds including the rise in ransomware and phishing attacks. 
    • Firm expects Mimecast to outperform Q2 estimates and have revised their own Q2 revenue estimate up to $61.8M from $60.1M. 
    • Mimecast shares are up 2%.       
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • NTES

    NetEase to buy $11B in overseas goods in e-commerce push

    • NetEase (NTES +10%) will spend about $11B on inventory for its e-commerce unit, a major push into that area from its core business of videogames.
    • Kaola counterprograms against dominant Chinese e-tailer Alibaba (BABA +2.6%) by buying almost all of its inventory directly from overseas to lower costs. Its CEO Zhang Lei tells Bloomberg that the company will ramp up buying form the U.S., Europe and Japan, and the number could go higher than $11B after factoring in purchases from Australia and South Korea.
    • “This industry could be worth 500B yuan ($75B) by about 2021,” Zhang says. “This is a new race course -- Kaola wants to be a major leader here and capture much of the market share from the existing leaders.”
    • Kaola has about 24% of the cross-border e-commerce market, to Alibaba's Tmall Global's 20%, and Vipshop's (VIPS +0.7%) 16%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 17 Comments
  • WFT

    Weatherford downgraded at Citi as turnaround likely to take time

    • Weatherford (WFT +2.1%) is higher despite receiving a downgrade to Neutral from Buy with a $4.20 price target, cut from $5.60, at Citigroup, which says new CEO Mark McCollum does not have a magic wand and the company's turnaround is going to take time.
    • WFT's free cash flow is unlikely to materialize until 2019 or even later, and the valuation is unappealing, says Citi analyst Scott Gruber.
    • Given that free cash flow could be limited through 2020, Citi says WFT may have to carry out major asset sales to reduce its debt; the firm says WFT now is aiming to reduce leverage rather than net debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • BLMN

    Credit Suisse drops estimates on Bloomin' Brands

    • Credit Suisse slashes targets on Bloomin' Brands (BLMN -1.8%) after taking in the company's Q3 earnings report and weak guidance analyst.
    • Analyst Jason West and team drop their 2017 EPS estimate to $1.35 from $1.41 and take the 2018 EPS estimate to $1.29 from $1.48. The price target goes to $18.00 from $18.50.
    • Credit Suisse on Bloomin':"We struggle to see how BLMN will grow earnings next yr. due to: 1) continued weak core margin trends, 2) lapping 53rd week, 3) higher food infl., 4) ongoing labor infl., and 5) minimal store growth."
    • Previously: Bloomin' Brands misses by $0.03, revenue in-line (Nov. 3)
    • Previously: Bloomin' Brands lower after earnings (Nov. 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • CLW

    Capacity concerns ding containerboard stocks

    • The weakness in paper/containerboard stocks today is being attributed by KeyBanc to a new recycled containerboard mill in Ohio that is adding to overcapacity concerns.

    Kosmos Energy sees return to drilling at Ghana's TEN project in early 2018

    • Kosmos Energy (KOS +5%) surges near a two-year high after reporting in-line Q3 earnings and revenue that more than doubled from a year ago.
    • KOS said in today's earnings conference call that it expects to resume development drilling on the multi-billion dollar TEN deepwater oil and gas project in Ghana early next year rather than near the end of 2017 as previously expected, and is working with its partners to bring a second rig into the country in 2018.

  • ACAD

    Mid-stage study of Acadia's pimavanserin hits primary endpoint, but fails on key secondaries; shares down 7%

    • ACADIA Pharmaceuticals (ACAD -6.9%) slumps on almost double normal volume in response to final results from a Phase 2 clinical trial, the -019 Study, assessing NUPLAZID (pimavanserin) for the treatment of Alzheimer's disease psychosis. The data were presented at the 10th Clinical Trials on Alzheimer's Disease meeting in Boston.
    • The study met its primary endpoint demonstrating a statistically significant treatment effect versus placebo as measured by a scale called NPI-NH Psychosis score at week 6.
    • Pimavanserin failed to statistically separate from placebo on key secondary endpoints measured by two scales: ADCS-CGIC and CMAI-SF and on the exploratory endpoints of change of NPI-NH Psychosis score at week 12 or a scale measuring daily activities called ADCS-ADL.
    • A Phase 3 study, HARMONY, assessing pimavanserin for the treatment of hallucinations and delusions associated with dementia-related psychosis is underway with an estimated completion date of March 2020. The primary endpoint is the time to relapse up to week 26, but the specific metric is not provided.
    • Previously: Acadia giving up gains as investors realize the "successful" mid-stage of pimavanserin failed to achieve the primary endpoint (Dec. 20, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 29 Comments

  • FOX

    CNBC: Fox in talks to sell most of itself to Disney

    • In a blockbuster report, CNBC says that Twenty-First Century Fox (FOX, FOXA) has been holding talks to sell most of itself to Walt Disney (NYSE:DIS).
    • The talks have come this month and as always, no certainty of any deal.
    • Disney shares have jumped 1.6%; FOX has vaulted 5.9%, FOXA up 5.7%.
    • FOXA shares have been halted limit up.
    • What would be left of Fox after such a transaction? A company tightly focused on news and sports, David Faber reports.
    • Meanwhile such a purchase would take out a competitor to Disney's film studio and give the Mouse House significant TV production assets.
    • But Disney can't own two broadcast networks, so Fox broadcast would be left behind, as would Fox Sports for antitrust concerns with ESPN.
    • The two aren't immediately talking, Faber says.

    Cell tower firms at new highs with mobile merger off the table

    • Communications tower firms are on the rise today, just as they've marked gains with every hitch in the merger talks between Sprint and T-Mobile (which are now presumably off for good).
    • American Tower (NYSE:AMT) is up 5.6%; SBA Communications (NASDAQ:SBAC) is up 6.4% and Crown Castle (NYSE:CCI) is up 5.4%. All three have hit 52-week highs today, with a status quo of four major U.S. wireless companies as customers.
    • At this point it seems "unlikely that the tower companies’ customers will ever go from 4 to 3," writes Wells Fargo's Jennifer Fritzsche, who notes that Sprint (S -10.6%) may be more likely to push network spending now that it's definitely going it alone.
    • Meanwhile, while she says that both AT&T (T -1.8%) and Verizon (VZ -4.1%) would have benefited from a more peaceful sector with the merger, the breakup of the deal is worse for Verizon since AT&T's Time Warner deal gives it more revenue diversification.

  • DISH

    Spectrum-heavy Dish Network +6% amid upgrade, telecom musical chairs

    • Dish Network (NASDAQ:DISH) is up 5% today thanks to an upgrade at Pivotal Research to Buy, and in part due to the usual telecom M&A machinations that move the stock (particularly between Sprint and T-Mobile).
    • Pivotal points to the breakdown of a Sprint/T-Mobile merger as a positive, considering Dish is sitting on a healthy spectrum hoard that will have value to at least one of the key wireless players. Shares have been underperforming and are an attractive risk/reward proposition now, the firm says.
    • With the wireless merger off, Sprint owner SoftBank has begun making new overtures toward a merger with Charter, which like Comcast has been moving into offering wireless service through resale arrangements with Verizon. Meanwhile, Sprint has hooked up in a similar arrangement with Altice USA, and Dish is often floated for tie-ups with Sprint (S -11.7%) or T-Mobile.
    • There's a "reasonable chance" that T-Mobile (TMUS -5.7%) wants either Dish Network or at least its spectrum and that could cause a counter-bid from Verizon (VZ -4.2%), Pivotal's Jeffrey Wlodarczak says. AT&T (T -1.6%) could also be interested in Dish's core satellite business for its own TV needs, he writes (h/t Bloomberg).
    • Along with the upgrade, Pivotal trimmed its Dish price target to $65 from $68, implying 28% upside from the current higher price.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 44 Comments
  • FLKS

    Flex Pharma's FLX-787 shows positive effect in mid-stage study in ALS cramping; shares ahead 4%

    • An exploratory Phase 2 clinical trial in Australia assessing Flex Pharma's (FLKS +4.2%) FLX-787 in ALS patients with frequent muscle cramps showed a treatment effect.
    • In eight patients who completed the study, treatment with FLX-787 produced a statistically significant reduction from baseline in both cramp-associated pain intensity and stiffness compared to control. Subjects experienced a median of 4.4 cramp-free days compared to none for placebo.
    • The study was terminated early so the company could focus its resources on the U.S. Phase 2b ALS trial, COMMEND.
    • The company describes FLX-787 as a transient receptor potential ion channel activator, specifically a co-activator of the proteins TRPA1 and TRPV1.
    • Previously: Flex Pharma launches mid-stage study of FLX-787 in ALS (Aug. 1)

  • NVCN

    Neovasc on go with pivotal study of Reducer in angina patients; shares ahead 7%

    • The FDA has signed off on a pivotal clinical trial, COSIRA-II, evaluating Neovasc's (NVCN +6.9%) Reducer system in patients with refractory angina. The 380-subject study is similar to previously completed COSIRA.
    • The Neovasc Reducer, placed via catheter akin to a stent procedure, helps relieve angina symptoms by altering blood flow in the circulatory system which increases the perfusion of oxygenated blood to areas of the heart that are not receiving sufficient blood flow.
    • The CE Mark'd device was launched in Europe two years ago. Results from COSIRA-II will support a U.S. marketing application.
